item.title: Template Design w/ Coding Development
item.dc:creator: @Doggie3342 Doggie3342
item.description:
@Doggie3342 wrote:

i would assume that he means that in the coded website, when you hover over a navbar link, it becomes a lighter shade of gray that is really similar to the navbar background and its hard to read. i liked how you had the navbar links in the original uncoded image (they were bold and the current page’s link was red, although i know you really cant do that yet as you only have one actual page). a few more small tweaks and it’ll be good. mainly, pleeeeeeaaase either get rid of the author, title, and date thing, or change the little business card thing that it is written on so that it isnt black and white. it is pretty much impossible to find a color of font that will look good and be legible on both black and white. lastly, it needs more color. i cant really pinpoint where you should add color, so i honestly don’t think this design will ever be better than decent, no matter how much tweaking and fine-tuning you do. start from scratch, make something a little more colorful.

Read full topic

item.title: Template Design w/ Coding Development
item.dc:creator: @Unid_H4x0r Unid H4x0r
item.description:
@Unid_H4x0r wrote:

[quote=“magma828, post:1, topic:225420”]Lorem Lipsum?[/quote]Yeah, mistake I was thinking of something else.

[quote=“Unhandled, post:19, topic:224811”]If this was 1995, I’d say good job, but it’s not. Whatever a web 2.0 design is, it’s not that. The colours are terrible, the striped border is huge, and it’s fixed height…Seriously, fixed height?

...
You should try learning how to properly make a design into a real website (no, pressing the “Save for web” button is not the proper way).
I could go on attempting to add some constructiveness to this post, but what’s the point, you won’t learn from it.

All in all, every design you make sucks, either give up or stop posting them.
Thanks.[/quote]Although people say using tables is a no no, it still works. It’s the fastest way, it doesn’t harm anyone. For the fixed height, from PhotoShop, I’m going to make it so it isn’t like that next time. Why are using tables so bad? Maybe you should have had constructive criticism. If you weren’t, why did you post? I would actually learn from it…

Read full topic

I’ll get rid of the paperclip. @Fast, the Author, etc was hard to choose colors for, got an idea for them??

Not sure, maybe something that you could read?
[/quote]Shit! I should have thought of that. Your so smart FastBawlz. I didn’t realize that people had to be able to see it, if not - what’s the point? You were extremely helpful, thank you! Next time I have a question, your the person to ask![/quote]

You laid on the sarcasm a little much.

item.title: Template Design w/ Coding Development
item.dc:creator: @Unhandled Unhandled
item.description:
@Unhandled wrote:

If this was 1995, I’d say good job, but it’s not. Whatever a web 2.0 design is, it’s not that. The colours are terrible, the striped border is huge, and it’s fixed height…Seriously, fixed height?

	</tr>
	<tr>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="62" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="10" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="53" height="1" alt=""></td>

		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="92" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="271" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="33" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="116" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>

			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="14" height="1" alt=""></td>
		<td>
			<img src="images/spacer.gif" width="61" height="1" alt=""></td>
	</tr>
</table>
<!-- End ImageReady Slices -->

You should try learning how to properly make a design into a real website (no, pressing the “Save for web” button is not the proper way).
I could go on attempting to add some constructiveness to this post, but what’s the point, you won’t learn from it.

All in all, every design you make sucks, either give up or stop posting them.
Thanks.

Read full topic

Props Unid, because this is a lot better than your other stuff. Still needs a lot of tweaking, like the paper clip. Maybe have the paper clip holding onto the logo (I assume that’s what it is) so it has a purpose? It needs some colour also. But yeah, it’s an improvement. Keep trying.
